p: Extracts of Scutellaria baicalensis contain flavonoids such as 5,7,4′-trihydroxy-8-methoxyflavone, baicalein, and 5,7,8,4′-tetrahydroxyflavone. These extracts showed antiviral properties that inhibited the neuraminidase activity of Sendai virus and Infuenza A H5N1 ( Hou and Lu, 2009). Houttuynia cordata Thunb is a traditional Chinese medicine used for treating pneumonia and lung-related ailments. It is also found active against SARS-CoV ( Lau et al., 2018).
